newsitem.title: GERMANY: Deutsche denies plans to close branches.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche denies plans to close branches.

text.p: Deutsche Bank AG, Germany's largest commercial bank, on Tuesday said it had no plans to close half of its main branch offices but was mulling a restructuring of its entire branch system.
A Deutsche Bank spokesman this morning denied a report in today's edition of the Handelsblatt newspaper saying the bank planned to close half of its 16 main branch offices.
"This is not the case," said a Deutsche Bank spokesman in answer to a Reuter enquiry.
But he said the bank was mulling a restructuring of the entire branch network although no decisions had been taken.
